newsitem.title: UK: IPE GAS OIL SEEN $2 UP, BRENT FLAT TO 5 CTS OFF.
newsitem.headline: IPE GAS OIL SEEN $2 UP, BRENT FLAT TO 5 CTS OFF.

text.p: IPE gas oil futures are expected to open about $2 a tonne firmer on Thursday after surging U.S. gasoline prices drove the energy complex higher late on Wednesday, brokers said.
Brent crude, however, should open steady to a shade softer after the September contract ended 14 cents higher at $18.99 a barrel, propelled briefly above $19 by NYMEX gasoline.
"Gas oil is due a bit more than $2 up but it all depends whether you believe this gasoline rally's going to last," said a broker.
Sept gas oil settled at $170.00 a tonne.
